intro: Weinmannia subvelutina, commonly known as the silky weinmannia, is a shrub or small tree native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic, and often have a waxy texture. Weinmannia subvelutina is well adapted to coastal climates, tolerating salt spray and sandy soils.
